thread.title: Trump Slams ‘Unprecedented Judicial Overreach’ On Travel Ban
thread.title_full: Trump Slams ‘Unprecedented Judicial Overreach’ On Travel Ban

author: Jack Davis
title: Trump Slams ‘Unprecedented Judicial Overreach’ On Travel Ban

organizations.name: trump slams ‘unprecedented judicial overreach’ on travel ban

text:
“We’re going to win. We’re going to keep our citizens safe,” the president said. “The danger is clear. The law is clear. The need for my executive order is clear.” 
Trump said that as president, he was in within his authority to make that decision. 
“This is… an unprecedented judicial overreach. The law and the Constitution give the president the power to suspend immigration when he deems… it to be in the national interest,” Trump said. 
Trump questioned the judge’s motives. 
“You don’t think that this was done by a judge for political reasons, do you?” Trump asked, then answered sarcastically, “Noooo.” 
Trump said the order was issued in the name of national security. 
“We’re talking about the safety of our nation, the safety and security of our people,” he said, adding, “This ruling makes us look weak.” 
The second order, Trump said, “was tailored to the dictates of the Ninth Circuit’s, in my opinion, flawed ruling.” 
“This is a watered-down version of the first one,” Trump told the Nashville crowd. “This is a watered-down version.” 
“Let me tell you something,” Trump added.”I think we ought to go back to the first one and go all the way, which is what I wanted to do in the first place.” What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
